text: Rathealy Ringfort is a ringfort (rath) and National Monument located in County Kilkenny, Ireland. ==Location== Rathealy Ringfort is located on a hilltop north of Tullaroan. ==History== Rathealy is believed to derive its name from Élothach mac Fáelchon, king of the Uí Cheinnselaig of South Leinster. There is a surrounding wall high and a ditch deep. It also known as the Stuaic of Rathealy, the Irish word meaning "peak" or "spike". A standing stone nearby may be pre-Christian. ==Description== Rathealy Ringfort is a trivallate rath with a rectangular house, circular house and souterrain entrance clearly visible. ==References== ==External links== * Category:Archaeological sites in County Kilkenny Category:National Monuments in County Kilkenny
title: Rathealy Ringfort
